author: daxian-dbw
body:
The test `TraceRoute works` in the context `TraceRoute` in the file `Test-Connection.Tests.ps1` is causing timeout in [macOS CI builds](https://dev.azure.com/powershell/PowerShell/_build/results?buildId=58605&view=logs&jobId=dd0d77e4-0911-5114-ec89-d447d00ba5e6&j=dd0d77e4-0911-5114-ec89-d447d00ba5e6&t=b551df83-c97f-5a24-b379-7e608cc7f18b).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/127450/88866719-5ea4b500-d1c0-11ea-872e-3a5bd82401a6.png)

We will make the test pending for further investigation.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I had no idea that the Net team could add code that is so unreliable. Maybe the PowerShell team can internally escalate this so that this network-based API is finally fixed?

comments.author: rjmholt
comments.body: I tried that in the last case though, and they insisted the issue is with the native API they call. Looking into it, I think they're right.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body:
:tada:This issue was addressed in #13324, which has now been successfully released as `v7.2.0-preview.2`.:tada:

Handy links:
* [Release Notes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.2.0-preview.2)

title: The 'TraceRoute' test take 44 minutes to fail in macOS CI
